This question requires a basic understanding of the concept of refraction. Refraction occurs when light waves pass through different mediums and change direction. In this case, the setup that is most likely to refract light is (D) gems and glowlights arranged precisely. Gemstones and glowlights have different optical properties than the surrounding air, so when light passes through them, it is likely to bend or refract. 

Option (A) is incorrect because a banjo and a flute are musical instruments and do not have any specific properties that would refract light. Option (B) is incorrect because two mirrors facing each other would create a reflection, not refraction. Option (C) is incorrect because a cat in a hat is a reference to a book and has no relation to the refraction of light.

Option (A), "a banjo and a flute," does not involve any objects or materials that are known to refract light. Option (B), "two mirrors in unison," refers to reflection rather than refraction. Option (C), "a cat in a hat," is unrelated to the properties of light.
